questions.question: His ideas are little different ……………………….. those of his father.
questions.description: We generally use from after different.

questions.question: The new job isn’t ……………………….. different from the old one.
questions.description: Different can be modified by little, any or not much. Many is not possible.

questions.question: This fragrance is ………………………….. different from that.
questions.description: Different can be modified by little. It cannot be modified by few.

questions.question: He is ……………………………. older than his wife.
questions.description: We cannot use very to modify comparatives.

questions.question: ‘Do you know Orwell’s books?’ ‘I haven’t read ……………………….’
questions.description: In negative sentences we use any.

questions.question: Economists doubt ……………………… prices will fall.
questions.description: We can use whether, if or that to introduce clauses after doubt.

questions.question: She was dressed ……………………….. a purple gown.
questions.description: The preposition in is used in this expression.

questions.question: …………………………. her illness, she could not attend the conference.
questions.description: Due to and owing to can both mean because of.

questions.question: She was in Mumbai ………………………… three weeks.
questions.description: We use for to indicate duration.

questions.question: The shop was closed ……………………….. the whole of May.
questions.description: We use during to talk about the whole of a period.

questions.question: Come up and see me ....................................
questions.description: We use sometime or one day to refer to an indefinite time in the future.

questions.question: One of my friends ........................................ a scientist.
questions.description: After one of, the verb is singular.
